page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN A RURAL AREA
page.content: The main means of transport in our area was the privately owned vehicle. The only other means of transport was by bus. The canal was in use, but on the survey day we did not see any boats or barges. The canal tunnel goes right under the village of Shrewley Common. The main fear of people in the surr- ounding area is the building of a motorway. Public opinion differs to whether it should be built.It would change the life of a quiet rural area. The speed limit in the villages in our area is 30 MPH, because of this most people by-pass the villages by going on the faster main road. Not many vehicles go through the villages. Public Transport can be described as lacking. All of the areas we visited had little or no public transport.Row- ington had just 2 buses per week.
